title: Hamas
summary: Hamas (UK: /hæˈmæs, ˈhæmæs/, US: /hɑːˈmɑːs, ˈhɑːmɑːs/; Arabic: حماس‎, romanized: Ḥamās, IPA: [ħaˈmaːs]; an acronym of حركة المقاومة الإسلامية Ḥarakat al-Muqāwamah al-ʾIslāmiyyah, "Islamic Resistance Movement") is a Palestinian Sunni-Islamic fundamentalist,[lower-alpha 3] militant,[16] and nationalist organization.[lower-alpha 4] It has a social service wing, Dawah, and a military wing, the Izz ad-Din al-Qassam Brigades.[lower-alpha 5][lower-alpha 6] It won the 2006 Palestinian legislative election[20] and became the de facto governing authority of the Gaza Strip following the 2007 Battle of Gaza.[21][22] It also holds a majority in the parliament of the Palestinian National Authority.
